It may be used freely by individuals for research, teaching, and personal use as long as this statement of availability is included in the text. bibl.title: [Letter] 1834 Jan. 26, Rural Rest [to] Major Sims / Ja[mes] M[oore] King
bibl.author: King, J.M.
bibl.note: This is a one page letter dated January 26, 1834 from James Moore King to Major Sims. The subject of the letter is the preparation of a dinner for the volunteer soldiers.

projectDesc.p: Created for the University of Tennessee Digital Library

editorialDecl.p: Quotation marks retained as data except inside q tags
Errors in transcription of the printed text controlled with X-Metal 3.0 spell-checker; text has also been thoroughly proofread.
Corrections and normalization represented by editorial tags.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

refsDecl.p: ID attributes provided for only those pages, chapters, or illustrations toward which a reference or figure points.

div1.p: In going to town yesterday their was but fiew pursons from the country in I soon discovered their was no arraingement making for a dinner their , for the vollntears I herd it said by some they understood their was a dinner going to give a dinner at Midleton

As they appear to be no preparation for a dinner in murfreesboro , I think it would be well , to make your arraingements and have one at some convinent plaice in that section of the county — If you go in for it, and I find out when you have a meting I will endeavour to attend , but at all events you may count on my being a subscriber and will be very apt to be at the dinner —

I think it highly important that we ⁁ show the token of gratitude in the receptiol of our Brave Patriotick and suffering Soaldiers, by inviting them to the festival boar partake with us at the festival board , where we can congratilat them for their Patriotism vallor and their return to their friend & county If it takes plaice rite me
